title: Tiffany Trump adopts a cat from a D.C. humane rescue group
text:
Tiffany Trump, daughter of President Trump and Marla Maples, and her boyfriend Michael Boulos adopted a cat from the Humane Rescue Alliance in D.C. (Humane Rescue Alliance)

Tiffany Trump has adopted a cat from Humane Rescue Alliance in Washington, D.C. The group said in a tweet that Trump and her boyfriend, Michael Boulos, adopted Orange Crush. The kitten is 7 weeks old and is a mix — a domestic shorthair and orange tabby, according to officials at the rescue group.

Authorities at the rescue alliance said Orange Crush came into the facility as a stray and its mom is a “community cat” that was spayed and returned to its community.

Congratulations to @TiffanyATrump and Michael Boulos who adopted Orange Crush today from the Humane Rescue Alliance. The pair adopted Orange Crush as a friend for Petals, who they brought home from HRA in June. We were thrilled to help them add a new kitten to their family! pic.twitter.com/L9z2Pyh5UG — Humane Rescue (@HumaneRescue) September 6, 2019

It’s Trump’s second cat from the group, which does about 4,100 cat and dog adoptions annually. Her first cat, Petals, was adopted from the Humane Rescue Alliance in June.



Tiffany Trump and her boyfriend adopted a cat named Orange Crush from the Humane Rescue Alliance in Washington. It's their second cat adoption from the group. (Humane Rescue Alliance)

The rescue group said in its tweet that “we were thrilled to help them add a new kitten to their family!”

Trump, the daughter of President Trump and Marla Maples, attends Georgetown University’s law school.
description: The cat is named Orange Crush.
